Title: AtCoder Beginner Contest 409
Name: Equilateral Triangle
Problem Statement:
There is a circle with circumference L, and points 1,2,...,N are placed on this circle. For i=1,2,...,N-1, point i+1 is located at a position that is d_i clockwise from point i on the circle.
Find the number of integer triples (a,b,c)\ (1≤ a\lt b\lt c≤ N) that satisfy both of the following conditions:
- The three points a, b, and c are all at different positions.
- The triangle with vertices at the three points a, b, and c is an equilateral triangle.
Constraints:
- 3≤ L,N≤ 3\times 10^5
- 0≤ d_i\lt L
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N L
d_1 d_2 ... d_{N-1}
Output
Output the answer.

Sample Detail.explanation:
The arrangement of the five points is as follows. Two pairs satisfy the conditions: (a,b,c)=(1,2,4),(1,4,5).
